pe_description: The Basic Materials sub-sector in Indonesia has a P/E ratio of 7.87, lower than the average IDX P/E ratio. health_description: The Basic Materials sub-sector's performance in the last 30 days was below average compared to the IDX, with only 19 out of 105 companies showing positive price changes. This sub-sector's health index can be affected by factors such as government regulations, commodity prices, and supply and demand dynamics. The Indonesian government, through the Ministry of Industry, is responsible for regulating the Basic Materials sub-sector and its policies can have a significant impact on the resilience of this sub-sector in Indonesia.
growth_description:
The Basic Materials sub-sector in Indonesia experienced a decline in growth over the past year, with an average YoY quarter earnings change of -36.38% and an average YoY quarter revenue change of 13.72%. The sub-sector ranked 27th in terms of earnings and 14th in terms of revenue compared to other sub-sectors. ###Central Omega Resources Tbk####, ###Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk####, and ###Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk#### were the companies with the highest YoY earning growth, YoY revenue growth, and net profit margin, respectively.

The growth of the Basic Materials sector in Indonesia can be affected by various factors, including changes in commodity prices, fluctuations in demand and supply, technological advancements, and government regulations. One noteworthy regulatory change that may impact the sector is the recent imposition of export tariffs on certain raw materials. This could potentially lead to a decrease in exports and a decline in revenue for companies in the Basic Materials sector.

pe_description: The Technology Hardware & Equipment sub-sector in Indonesia is currently trading at a P/E ratio of 9.93, which is higher than the average IDX P/E ratio. This indicates that investors are willing to pay a premium for companies in this sub-sector, potentially due to expectations of strong growth. Compared to last year's P/E ratio, the sub-sector has outperformed, suggesting that investors are becoming increasingly bullish on the sector's prospects. Within the sub-sector, three companies, '###PT Zyrexindo Mandiri Buana Tbk####', '###Sat Nusapersada Tbk####', and '###PT Galva Technologies Tbk####', are considered undervalued based on their P/E ratios, while '###PT Sentral Mitra Informatika Tbk.####' is considered overvalued. health_description: The Technology Hardware & Equipment sub-sector in Indonesia, comprised of 11 companies, has demonstrated resilience and outperformed the IDX in terms of average price changes over the past 30 days. While five companies exhibited positive price changes, the sub-sector's health index can be influenced by factors such as technological advancements, changes in consumer preferences, and government regulations. The Indonesian government body responsible for regulating this sub-sector is the Ministry of Industry, whose policies and decisions can impact the sub-sector's overall resilience and performance.
growth_description: The Technology Hardware & Equipment sub-sector has experienced significant growth in the past year, reflected by its high average YoY quarter earnings and revenue changes. It ranks among the top performers in terms of earnings and revenue compared to other sub-sectors. Within this sub-sector, ###PT Tera Data Indonusa Tbk#### stands out as the company with the highest YoY earning and revenue growth, while ###Sat Nusapersada Tbk#### boasts the highest net profit margin. These may include changes in consumer preferences, technological advancements, and regulatory shifts specific to the Technology Hardware & Equipment industry in Indonesia. Investors and stakeholders should closely monitor these factors to make informed decisions.

pe_description: The Logistics & Deliveries sub-sector in Indonesia exhibits a P/E ratio of 6.39, indicating that it is undervalued compared to the average IDX P/E ratio. health_description: The Logistics & Deliveries sub-sector in Indonesia, comprising 25 companies, ranks first in terms of price changes over the past 30 days. growth_description: The Logistics & Deliveries sub-sector in Indonesia has experienced a decline in growth over the past year, with an average YoY quarter earnings change of -17.19% and an average YoY quarter revenue change of 6.67%. health_description: The Transportation sub-sector in Indonesia, comprising 12 companies, currently ranks 34th in terms of price changes over the past 30 days, indicating its underperformance compared to the overall IDX. Investors in the stock market seek information about these factors to gauge the resilience and health of the Transportation sub-sector.
growth_description: The Transportation sub-sector in Indonesia has experienced a decline in growth over the past year, with an average YoY quarter earnings change of -15.01% and an average YoY quarter revenue change of 15.64%.
